description: Excel 2016 is the powerful spreadsheet application in the Office suite. It seems every organization, large and small, uses Excel to organize and analyze data. However, many users are intimidated by Excel and confused by how it behaves as an application. The Excel 2016 Essentials for Mac series strives to empower users by learning the foundations to conquer this program. We begin with basic skills such as navigating the interface, identifying items in a spreadsheet, selecting cells, and inputting data. The series also covers formatting text and numbers, modifying a worksheet layout, printing and page layout, and managing worksheets in a workbook. While this series is designed for beginner users, it has lots of great tips and tricks for experienced users as well.

While this series is designed for beginner users, it has lots of great tips and tricks for experienced users as well.

subtitle: Spreadsheet application

episodes.description: Excel 2016 is the powerful spreadsheet application in the Office suite. It seems every organization, large and small, uses Excel to organize and analyze data. However, many users are intimidated by Excel and confused by how it behaves as an application. The Excel 2016 Essentials for Mac series strives to empower users by learning the foundations to conquer this program. We begin with basic skills such as navigating the interface, identifying items in a spreadsheet, selecting cells, and inputting data. The series also covers formatting text and numbers, modifying a worksheet layout, printing and page layout, and managing worksheets in a workbook. While this series is designed for beginner users, it has lots of great tips and tricks for experienced users as well.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.025 --> 00:00:05.149
[SOUND] Hello everyone and welcome

2
00:00:05.149 --> 00:00:11.194
to Excel 2016 essentials for Mac.

3
00:00:11.194 --> 00:00:14.046
I'm your show host Vonn Smith and
in this course overview,

4
00:00:14.046 --> 00:00:18.030
we're going to be talking about what
exactly is covered in this series.

5
00:00:18.030 --> 00:00:19.290
Who is our target audience?

6
00:00:19.290 --> 00:00:21.930
Do we need to know anything
before we get started and

7
00:00:21.930 --> 00:00:23.890
any extra tidbits I have for you.

8
00:00:23.890 --> 00:00:25.210
As you can see,

9
00:00:25.210 --> 00:00:28.590
there's only two main topics that
we have in this particular series.

10
00:00:28.590 --> 00:00:30.605
We have the introduction and
format work books.

11
00:00:30.605 --> 00:00:33.740
But there is quite few things that
we talk about in each one of those.

12
00:00:33.740 --> 00:00:37.040
In the introduction we start from
the very beginning of like, what's Excel?

13
00:00:37.040 --> 00:00:38.250
What's the history of Excel?

14
00:00:38.250 --> 00:00:39.272
What's the file format?

15
00:00:39.272 --> 00:00:44.410
Then we get into some other basics
within the Mac operating system.

16
00:00:44.410 --> 00:00:48.400
We're still using Windows, and what is the
application window versus the worksheet

17
00:00:48.400 --> 00:00:51.400
window and how to navigate around that.

18
00:00:51.400 --> 00:00:56.040
And the interface of Excel, what is the
ribbon, where is the quick access toolbar,

19
00:00:56.040 --> 00:00:59.160
where is the status bar,
how do I get to the zooms and everything.

20
00:00:59.160 --> 00:01:02.200
So that's all within those
particular episodes.

21
00:01:02.200 --> 00:01:04.610
Then we're gonna get into
navigating a workbook.

22
00:01:04.610 --> 00:01:05.630
How do I get around?

23
00:01:05.630 --> 00:01:06.890
What's the name box?

24
00:01:06.890 --> 00:01:10.280
How can I use that to
get to particular cells?

25
00:01:10.280 --> 00:01:14.300
Using the keyboard to help us get around
to be a little more efficient and

26
00:01:14.300 --> 00:01:20.060
productive with getting around
a particular workbook and worksheets.

27
00:01:20.060 --> 00:01:22.290
And the all important,
how do I select things?

28
00:01:22.290 --> 00:01:25.840
We're gonna spend quite a bit of time

29
00:01:25.840 --> 00:01:30.480
within that particular episode about
different ways that we can do that, again,

30
00:01:30.480 --> 00:01:34.265
with keyboard shortcuts,
how to use your mouse to select to effect.

31
00:01:34.265 --> 00:01:39.275
Cuz you've gotta make sure you know where
to select before you can do anything.

32
00:01:39.275 --> 00:01:42.460
Then we're gonna get into actually
inserting data into our cells.

33
00:01:42.460 --> 00:01:43.790
How do I type values in?

34
00:01:43.790 --> 00:01:45.410
How do I edit them?

35
00:01:45.410 --> 00:01:48.930
We'll also be covering fill series,
which is really fun, and

36
00:01:48.930 --> 00:01:50.210
different ways that we can go ahead and

37
00:01:50.210 --> 00:01:53.290
quickly get in things like the days of
the week and the months of the year.

38
00:01:54.760 --> 00:01:57.290
We also have an episode on cut,
copy, paste.

39
00:01:57.290 --> 00:01:59.720
Yes, an entire episode on it.

40
00:01:59.720 --> 00:02:01.040
You're thinking, hm, really?

41
00:02:01.040 --> 00:02:03.960
Well, in Excel,
it can get a little tricky.

42
00:02:03.960 --> 00:02:09.150
And there's some little gotchas in there
that you need to be aware of so that way

43
00:02:09.150 --> 00:02:14.550
you can understand what it's doing when
you copy something and paste something.

44
00:02:14.550 --> 00:02:17.100
Especially when you get into your rows and
columns.

45
00:02:17.100 --> 00:02:21.150
And then we'll talk about file formats and
how to export, which

46
00:02:21.150 --> 00:02:26.820
is really to just save as, and really
talk about the CSV file format at length.

47
00:02:26.820 --> 00:02:29.700
Then we get into how do I format
things within a workbook?

48
00:02:29.700 --> 00:02:32.920
Starting with modifying
the structure of your worksheets.

49
00:02:32.920 --> 00:02:36.830
How do I add or delete columns or rows?

50
00:02:36.830 --> 00:02:40.180
How do I change the widths of columns and
rows?

51
00:02:40.180 --> 00:02:43.380
We'll also get in to how to merge cells.

52
00:02:43.380 --> 00:02:45.270
Then we'll move on to formatting.

53
00:02:45.270 --> 00:02:49.440
We'll be formatting our cells with font,
color, size.

54
00:02:49.440 --> 00:02:53.400
We'll also do a little bit more with
horizontal and vertical alignment.

55
00:02:53.400 --> 00:02:55.130
We'll also talk about styles.

56
00:02:55.130 --> 00:02:58.760
I love styles and how they can
be really handy and helpful for

57
00:02:58.760 --> 00:03:03.205
formatting your data within
your worksheets and workbooks.

58
00:03:03.205 --> 00:03:06.280
Then we get into the all
important number formats, okay?

59
00:03:06.280 --> 00:03:08.290
A big deal within Excel.

60
00:03:08.290 --> 00:03:11.130
A very important concept and
topic to understand,

61
00:03:11.130 --> 00:03:13.590
so we have some good information there.

62
00:03:13.590 --> 00:03:16.125
Then we go into page layout for printing.

63
00:03:16.125 --> 00:03:19.525
Now, yes, this is a spreadsheet
application, but you are normally or

64
00:03:19.525 --> 00:03:23.284
most likely going to be printing, so
we need to know those different options.

65
00:03:23.284 --> 00:03:27.338
We'll get into page breaks and
how do I do shrinking and

66
00:03:27.338 --> 00:03:31.584
how do I fit things on pages
that you want to have printed.

67
00:03:31.584 --> 00:03:35.962
And we'll also talk about
managing our workbooks, meaning,

68
00:03:35.962 --> 00:03:38.115
how do I rename my worksheets?

69
00:03:38.115 --> 00:03:42.150
How do I change the tab colors and
organizing them?

70
00:03:43.580 --> 00:03:44.780
So who is this for?

71
00:03:44.780 --> 00:03:48.000
This is for all Office users,
with a capital O,

72
00:03:48.000 --> 00:03:54.040
meaning you're using Office 365 or
a locally installed version of Excel.

73
00:03:54.040 --> 00:03:56.070
And this would be starting at the basics,

74
00:03:56.070 --> 00:03:57.900
I mean, we'll start from
the very beginning and move up.

75
00:03:57.900 --> 00:04:01.325
So I would say this would be for
anybody that has some basic skills and

76
00:04:01.325 --> 00:04:05.470
want to move up into the intermediate
level of knowing Excel.

77
00:04:05.470 --> 00:04:07.220
I would say that would
be the target audience.

78
00:04:07.220 --> 00:04:09.400
Do you need to know anything?

79
00:04:09.400 --> 00:04:12.680
You need to know a little a bit about
how the Mac operating system works.

80
00:04:12.680 --> 00:04:16.690
So it's a general understanding of like
where is the Finder and to open and

81
00:04:16.690 --> 00:04:17.750
close files.

82
00:04:17.750 --> 00:04:20.430
We do cover that on our episodes as well.

83
00:04:20.430 --> 00:04:23.158
You don't need anything
of Excel to get started.

84
00:04:23.158 --> 00:04:24.910
Maybe you've used it a little bit and

85
00:04:24.910 --> 00:04:28.470
want like a refresher course or
just different ways of doing things.

86
00:04:28.470 --> 00:04:30.510
This is a great series to start with that.

87
00:04:30.510 --> 00:04:34.780
And maybe familiarity with other
Office products could be helpful.

88
00:04:34.780 --> 00:04:36.680
Not imperative.

89
00:04:36.680 --> 00:04:40.830
Just you wanna start somewhere
from the beginning in Excel,

90
00:04:40.830 --> 00:04:42.470
this is the series for you.

91
00:04:43.650 --> 00:04:47.910
There's always other options of how to do
things in all of your Office programs,

92
00:04:47.910 --> 00:04:49.750
Excel included.

93
00:04:49.750 --> 00:04:54.508
Everybody has a different reason why they
want to use Excel and how they use Excel.

94
00:04:54.508 --> 00:04:59.150
So, I am trying to show you from just
a practical standpoint of how to use

95
00:05:00.160 --> 00:05:01.415
this particular product.

96
00:05:01.415 --> 00:05:04.567
So, just do be aware that everybody
has different reasons for

97
00:05:04.567 --> 00:05:07.610
using them and that kinda ties
into the different options.

98
00:05:09.010 --> 00:05:11.510
Updates do happen, yes.

99
00:05:11.510 --> 00:05:15.740
Because this is an Office 366 product,
there is going to be updates.

100
00:05:15.740 --> 00:05:18.950
So, at the time of this recording,
I have a particular version.

101
00:05:18.950 --> 00:05:22.120
When you're watching it, there might
have been some more updates, and so

102
00:05:22.120 --> 00:05:24.190
things might be a little bit different.

103
00:05:24.190 --> 00:05:26.220
So definitely check
about your versions and

104
00:05:26.220 --> 00:05:30.270
where to find what version
of Excel you are working in.

105
00:05:30.270 --> 00:05:34.260
We talk about that in the introduction
episode within this course.

106
00:05:34.260 --> 00:05:35.680
So just be aware of it.

107
00:05:35.680 --> 00:05:40.120
And, of course, there's tons of
information about Excel online through

108
00:05:40.120 --> 00:05:42.770
the different Microsoft help files and
other websites.

109
00:05:42.770 --> 00:05:47.150
So definitely use the Internet to
your advantage to search for answers.

110
00:05:47.150 --> 00:05:49.170
And of course, have some fun.

111
00:05:49.170 --> 00:05:51.630
Excel can be frustrating
from time to time.

112
00:05:51.630 --> 00:05:53.490
I can understand, I have been there.

113
00:05:53.490 --> 00:05:55.857
But hopefully going
through these episodes,

114
00:05:55.857 --> 00:05:58.350
you'll have a better understanding of it.

115
00:05:58.350 --> 00:06:01.700
And I like to have fun,
I hope you have fun and

116
00:06:01.700 --> 00:06:05.061
I hope you learn a lot and
I will see you soon.

117
00:06:05.061 --> 00:06:10.058
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne kick off the Microsoft Excel 2016 Essentials for Mac series. They define  a spreadsheet, discuss the history of Excel and file types, and introduce other foundational concepts for this course.
episodes.title: Introduction to Excel

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne cover the basics of working with Excel in the Macintosh operating system. They review foundational skills and items such as starting Excel, the title bar, minimize and maximize, full screen mode, create a blank workbook, open an existing workbook, save vs. save as, and keyboard shortcuts.
episodes.title: Excel Basics

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne examine  the Excel user interface (UI). Here you will learn about the title bar, the ribbon, quick access toolbar, formula bar, name box, and status bar.
episodes.title: Excel Interface

episodes.description: Justin and Vonne demonstrate how to navigate a workbook . They will explain the different mouse cursors icons, scrolling, keyboard navigation, navigating with the name box, zooming, and choosing worksheets.
episodes.title: Navigate a Workbook

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne explore the multiple ways that you can select and work with cells in Excel. They demonstrate  click/hold/drag, deselecting, range selecting, selecting with shift and arrow keys, select all, select multiple worksheets, select text in multiple worksheets, named ranges, and how to use find and replace.
episodes.title: Select Cells

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne explore the variety of ways that you can insert data into your Excel worksheet. Here they cover: entering data into a cell, editing data in a cell, data and cell overflow, autocorrect options, move data to new cell, and clear cell data.
episodes.title: Insert Data

episodes.description: Justin and Vonne review cut, copy, and paste in Excel.  While this might seem like a straight forward topic, there are a few caveats with these functions that can cause a user stress if not aware. They also cover undo and redo commands.
episodes.title: Cut, Copy, Paste

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne explore how to fill series of data. This feature expands the way you copy and paste data and will predict ranges like dates and common item lists.
episodes.title: Fill Series

episodes.description: Vonne and Justin take a closer look at fill series, specifically covering how to create a custom list series and how to edit existing lists.
episodes.title: Fill Series: Custom Lists

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne go through the common file types supported by Excel 2016. Here they explain .xlsx files, Comma Separated Value(.csv) files, OpenDocument Spreadsheet(.ods) files, and Excel Templates(.xltx) files.
episodes.title: Export and File Types

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne explore modifying a worksheet in Excel 2016. They demonstrate how to select columns and rows, change column height and row width, insert and delete rows/columns, hide columns and rows, merge cells, and apply word wrap to cells.
episodes.title: Modify a Worksheet

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne show how to format a worksheet in Excel 2016. They cover selecting fonts, aligning cell content, adding borders and shading, and copying formats with the format painter.
episodes.title: Format a Worksheet

episodes.description: Justin and Vonne continue to discuss cell formatting, specifically covering cell styles.  They show how to apply styles, modify and update styles, and create custom styles.  They also demonstrate how themes are connected to styles and the overall formatting of a workbook.
episodes.title: Styles and Themes

episodes.description: Vonne and Justin start a small mini series on number formats.  In this episode, they introduce number formats and discuss the difference between inputted data vs displayed data.
episodes.title: Number Formats: Introduction

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Justin cover the following number format categories: number, currency, accounting, percentage, fractions, and scientific notation.
episodes.title: Number Formats: Common Number Formats

episodes.description: Vonne and Justin continue with number formats, specifically covering the text, special, and custom categories.
episodes.title: Number Formats: Text, Special, Custom

episodes.description: Justin and Vonne finish the number format mini series by discussing date and time number formats. They also introduce the DATEVALUE function.
episodes.title: Number Formats: Date and Time

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne demonstrate how to proof and control page layout for printing. They show how to spellcheck a worksheet and the options for ignoring or adding to the dictionary as well as how to use the thesaurus and smart lookup.  They also cover print preview and introduce page layout view to add and modify page elements.
episodes.title: Proof, Print and Page Layout

episodes.description:
"
Justin and Vonne continue discussing page layout. In this episode, they show how to modify page layout elements from the page layout view such as headers and footers, page orientation, and margins. They also go over adding print titles, setting a print area, and controlling page breaks."
episodes.title: Proof, Print and Page Layout Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne finish up the series by demonstrating how to manage workbooks and worksheets. Here they show you how to rename worksheet tabs, change tab color, rearrange worksheets, create new and delete worksheets, and copy/hide/move worksheets. They also show how to control view options such as freeze panes, split view, new windows, and arranging windows.
episodes.title: Manage Worksheets and Workbooks
